fields.summary: Services in ELB instance doesn't come up properly

status.name: Closed

fields.summary: ELB fails to create instance per availability zone

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
*Assessment*

If an autoscaling group is attached to an ELB ([KB article as an example|https://support.eucalyptus.com/hc/en-us/articles/202440330-Steps-to-Create-HTTPS-SSL-Elastic-Load-Balancer-on-Eucalyptus]) and anything happens to the ELB, the autoscaling group will perform instance lifecycle churn (i.e. cycle of launch/terminate). 

The following issues will cause the churn to occur:
* ELB fails to launch correctly.  For example, ELB failed to launch because of fsck issues:
{code}
[root@c-02 ~]# euca-get-console-output i-c5308d99 --region elb-admin@region-1
i-c5308d99

^[[1;256r^[[256;256H^[[6n
Google, Inc.
Serial Graphics Adapter 12/07/11
SGABIOS $Id: sgabios.S 8 2010-04-22 00:03:40Z nlaredo $ (mockbuild@c6b18n1.dev.centos.org) Wed Dec  7 17:04:47 UTC 2011
Term: 80x24
4 0
SeaBIOS (version seabios-0.6.1.2-30.el6)
Machine UUID 717132fb-b956-99a8-790d-bbdfd0023ade


gPXE (http://etherboot.org) - 00:03.0 C100 PCI2.10 PnP BBS PMM0FE0@10 C100


Booting from Hard Disk...
Press any key to continue.
Press any key to continue.
^[[H^[[J
    GNU GRUB  version 0.97  (622K lower / 261108K upper memory)

^[[m^[[4;2H+-------------------------------------------------------------------------+^[[5;2H|^[[5;76H|^[[6;2H|^[[6;76H|^[[7;2H|^[[7;76H|^[[8;2H|^[[8;76H|^[[9;2H|^[[9;76H|^[[10;2H|^[[10;76H|^[[11;2H|^[[11;76H|^[[12;2H|^[[12;76H|^[[13;2H|^[[13;76H|^[[14;2H|^[[14;76H|^[[15;2H|^[[15;76H|^[[16;2H|^[[16;76H|^[[17;2H+-------------------------------------------------------------------------+^[[m
      Use the ^ and v keys to select which entry is highlighted.
      Press enter to boot the selected OS, 'e' to edit the
      commands before booting, 'a' to modify the kernel arguments
      before booting, or 'c' for a command-line.^[[5;78H ^[[m^[[7m^[[5;3H CentOS 6 (2.6.32-573.3.1.el6.x86_64)                                    ^[[5;75H^[[m^[[m^[[6;3H                                                                         ^[[6;75H^[[m^[[m^[[7;3H                                                                         ^[[7;75H^[[m^[[m^[[8;3H                                                                         ^[[8;75H^[[m^[[m^[[9;3H                                                                         ^[[9;75H^[[m^[[m^[[10;3H                                                                         ^[[10;75H^[[m^[[m^[[11;3H                                                                         ^[[11;75H^[[m^[[m^[[12;3H                                                                         ^[[12;75H^[[m^[[m^[[13;3H                                                                         ^[[13;75H^[[m^[[m^[[14;3H                                                                         ^[[14;75H^[[m^[[m^[[15;3H                                                                         ^[[15;75H^[[m^[[m^[[16;3H                                                                         ^[[16;75H^[[m^[[16;78H ^[[5;75H^[[23;4HThe highlighted entry will be booted automatically in 1 seconds.    ^[[5;75H^[[H^[[J
Error 16: Inconsistent filesystem structure

Press any key to continue...
{code}
* ELB has been terminated after it was 'linked' to autoscaling group via euscale-create-autoscaling-group.

*Steps*

# Deploy Eucalyptus 4.2 (4.2.0-0.0.23890.654.20150918git84e694a.el6) multi-cluster, single cloud with Eucalyptus DNS configured - [hspencer-1321|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/1321/]
# Create 'devops' account
# Created Auto Scaling launch config using 'devops/admin' user credentials:
{code}
[root@c-02 ~]# euscale-create-launch-config --image-id emi-b87dbd02 --group nginx-sg --user-data-file nginx-cloudinit.config -t m1.medium NginxConfig --region devops-admin@region-1
{code}
# Launched ELB using 'devops/admin' user credentials:
{code}
[root@c-02 ~]# eulb-create-lb -z one,two -l "lb-port=80, protocol=HTTP, instance-port=80, instance-protocol=HTTP" NginxLoadBalancers --region devops-admin@region-1
DNS_NAME	NginxLoadBalancers-000693176866.lb.c-02.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
{code}
# Authorized traffic between ELB security group and security group for autoscaling group:
{code}
[root@c-02 ~]# euca-authorize -P tcp -p -1 -o euca-internal-000693176866-NginxLoadBalancers -u 000770154596 nginx-sg --region devops-admin@region-1
GROUP	nginx-sg
PERMISSION	nginx-sg	ALLOWS	tcp	1	65535	USER	000770154596	NAME	euca-internal-000693176866-NginxLoadBalancers	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0
{code}
# Created Autoscaling group:
{code}
[root@c-02 ~]# euscale-create-auto-scaling-group NginxScalingGroup --launch-configuration NginxConfig --min-size 2 --max-size 4 --load-balancers NginxLoadBalancers --health-check-type ELB --availability-zones one,two --region devops-admin@region-1
[root@c-02 ~]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups --region devops-admin@region-1
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	NginxScalingGroup	NginxConfig	one,two	NginxLoadBalancers	2	4	2	Default
INSTANCE	i-40ce124c	one	Pending	Healthy	NginxConfig
INSTANCE	i-2b099bab	two	Pending	Healthy	NginxConfig
{code}
# Configured health check on ELB:
{code}
[root@c-02 ~]# eulb-configure-healthcheck NginxLoadBalancers --target "HTTP:80/" --interval 240 --timeout 2 --unhealthy-threshold 5 --healthy-threshold 5 --region devops-admin@region-1
HEALTH_CHECK	HTTP:80/	240	2	5	5
{code}
# Noticed cycle of instances being terminated and re-launched:
{code}
[root@c-02 ~]# euca-describe-instances --region devops-admin@region-1
RESERVATION	r-f4fbdad2	000693176866

fields.summary: ELB issues cause autoscaling instance churn

comments.body:
The instance churn up to step 8 (before ELB is deleted) is correct, because ELB is used for autoscaling group's health check and the instance is not healthy because of faulty ELB.
The question is whether churn should happen if the ELB by which autoscaling group is checking instance's health, is deleted. I checked with AWS' behavior and they keep the instance in "Healthy" state when the ELB is deleted. So there's no churn happening there.
I don't think this is blocker, although certainly it's a bug.
Agree this is not a blocker. If AWS stops doing autoscaling ELB health checks if the ELB has been deleted, I think we should follow that behavior.
